intro: Erythrococca anomala, commonly known as the red cocculus, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features include stipulate leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
